required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antioxidant-rich Diet and Oxidative Stress in Healthy Preschoolers
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of an Antioxidant-rich Kindergarten Diet on Oxidative Stress in Healthy Preschool Children

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Medicine

clinical_study.source: University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
Uncontrolled and prolonged oxidative stress plays an important role in the onset and progression of cardiovascular disease, hyperlipidemia, diabetes, and various cancers. Given that many diseases can start as early as childhood, eating patterns in childhood and preventing oxidative damage can have beneficial long-term health effects. Antioxidant-rich foods can slow down the progression of chronic diseases.
In Slovenian kindergartens (and schools) children consume up to 70% of their daily energy and nutritional needs, so what is offered to them is very important. This study will evaluate the hypothesis that providing an antioxidant-rich diet in kindergartens can result in the reduction of biomarkers of oxidative stress.

primary_outcome.description: Change in oxidative stress biomarkers of lipids (malondialdehyde (MDA), and four F2 - isoprostane isomers, namely 8 -iso-prostaglandin F2α (8-PGF2α), 11ß- prostaglandin F2α (11-PGF2α), 15 (R)-prostaglandin F2α (15-PGF 2α) and 8-iso, 15 prostaglandin F2α (8,15-PGF2α) ; proteins (o,oʼ-dityrosine (diY) and DNA 8-Hydroxy-2'-deoxyguanosine (8-OhdG) between day 1 and day 15 of the intervention diet, measured by HPLC-MS/MS

intervention.description: Antioxidant-rich diet (added selected types of fruits, vegetables, nuts, cereals and oils)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Healthy children aged 5-6 who will attend the compulsory medical examination before entering primary school
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Children with chronic conditions (e.g. diabetes, asthma)
- Children with allergies to food (e.g. gluten, egg, milk, lactose intolerance)

facility.name: University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Medicine
